articles.author: Steve Holland, Gram Slattery, Erin Banco
articles.description: Trump's selection of Rubio to replace Waltz temporarily will be the first time since Henry Kissinger in the 1970s that one person has held both the positions of secretary of state and national security adviser simultaneously.
articles.title: Trump ousts White House national security adviser Waltz, replaces him with Rubio

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kyiv and Washington on Thursday hailed a deal giving the United States preferential access to new Ukrainian minerals as a milestone which a top U.S. official said would allow President Donald Trump to negotiate with Russia on a stronger basis.
articles.title: US says minerals deal will strengthen Trump in talks with Russia

articles.author: Eric Onstad, Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: The financial payoff from a new minerals deal between Ukraine and the U.S. is likely to take a decade or longer as investors face many hurdles to getting new mines into production in the war-ravaged country.
articles.title: US, Ukraine may wait decade or more to see revenue from minerals deal

articles.author: Doyinsola Oladipo, Karen Freifeld, Rich McKay
articles.description: Lawyers, teachers and politicians were among thousands of demonstrators across the U.S. on Thursday protesting policies on immigration, the targeting of lawyers and judges and the role of wealthy decision-makers under President Donald Trump's administration.
articles.title: May Day protesters across US rally against Trump policies, urge rule of law

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Ted Hesson
articles.description: A U.S. judge on Thursday blocked President Donald Trump's administration from using an 18th-century wartime law to deport some Venezuelan migrants, in the most sweeping ruling thus far against a key part of the Republican president's aggressive immigration crackdown.
articles.title: Trump's use of Alien Enemies Act for Venezuela deportations is unlawful, judge rules

articles.author: Emma Farge, John Shiffman
articles.description: The United Nations is considering a massive overhaul that would merge major departments and shift resources across the globe, according to an internal memo prepared by senior officials tasked with reforming the world body.
articles.title: Exclusive: UN eyes major overhaul amid funding crisis, internal memo shows

articles.author: Andrew Chung, John Kruzel
articles.description: President Donald Trump's administration asked the U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday to intervene in its bid to strip temporary protected status for more than 300,000 Venezuelan migrants, a move that would clear the way for their deportation.
articles.title: Trump turns to US Supreme Court in bid to strip protected status from Venezuelan migrants

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel said it carried out a strike in Syria against extremists who attacked members of the Druze community, following through on a promise to protect the minority group as sectarian violence spread near Damascus on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israel says it hit extremists in Syria to protect Druze

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian drone attack late on Thursday set buildings ablaze in Ukraine's southeastern city of Zaporizhzhia, killing one person and injuring at least eight, regional governor Ivan Fedorov said.
articles.title: Russian drones kill one, injure eight in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia, governor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Vice President JD Vance said on Thursday that Washington hoped Pakistan would cooperate with India to hunt down Pakistan-based militants, and hopes that India's response to the recent Islamist militant attack in India-administered Kashmir does not lead to a broader regional conflict.
articles.title: Vance says US hopes Pakistan cooperates with India against Pakistan-based militants
